data.title: Update Atom icon location when installing
data.body: I just uninstalled the webupd8team Atom ppa and Atom and installed via the [Ubuntu release](https://github.com/atom/atom#debian-linux-ubuntu). I can run Atom via the command line, which is how I am going to use it 99% of the time, but when using the icon, I get `Failed to execute command "/opt/atom/atom %F". Failed to execute child process "/opt/atom/atom" (No such file or directory)`. I'll probably just edit the location cited manually because nothing is in `/opt/atom/` anymore, and everything will be okay. Just passing along, thanks.

data.title: Reloading styles in shadow DOM on focused editor causes craziness
data.body:
1. Turn shadow DOM on
2. link a syntax theme, and make sure you're using that theme
3. `atom -d` in the syntax theme dir
4. Edit a stylesheet 
5. save
6. The editor goes gray and is unusable

It looks like the height is infinitely growing:

![crazy-height](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/5365038/690f5b06-7f9d-11e4-818d-a69c9f659c09.gif)
### Notes
- You can close that editor and everything is fine
- It only happens on the active editor when the window has focus. Change the file out side of atom with atom _not_ focused, and it's fine.

data.title: Allow PanelElements to be instantiated with markup
data.body: This is needed for the styleguide.

data.title: latest atom makes managing JSDocs terrible, especially with copy and paste
data.body:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSDoc

Stars are pushed to the left many times:

![screen shot 2014-12-09 at 11 24 12 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/643505/5364103/f2b99914-7f95-11e4-96de-be36a6159d9e.png)

Copying and pasting or creating a new line after a JS doc will create 1-space indents:

![screen shot 2014-12-09 at 11 25 29 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/643505/5364127/1bc47018-7f96-11e4-9cb1-6824ba8ac1ec.png)

data.title: Search box shoud have focus on directory search and not create a new file dialog
data.body: When one right clicks on a folder and select search directory the keyboard focus should be in the search box. It used to be so a few versions ago but stopped a few months ago for unknown reasons. It makes it a bit of a pain as the tendency is to type right after selecting search but this now causes a new file  dialog to open instead. Current version is 0.153

data.title: The caret overflows in the find and replace bar.
data.body:
I just saw this. The caret overflows in the find and replace bar. I think it should be made to scroll. I am adding a screenshot so that you can see.

Notice the white caret under the replace bar
## How to reproduce
- press Ctrl+F
- copy a newline from a text file
- paste it in the find or replace bar
- caret overflows
## Suggestion:
- Turn the find and replace bar into multiline input which scrolls just like sublime text

![Notice the white caret](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3696393/5362257/736254a4-7ff3-11e4-8648-466c341bcc83.png)

data.title: Prevent duplicate error toasts
data.body:
I like the new error toasts, but please prevent the same toast from appearing multiple times - I keep getting this (I'm sure you will appreciate this is annoying):

![screenshot from 2014-12-09 14 42 40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1596233/5358978/c65c0732-7fb1-11e4-9cff-715b136d086f.png)

data.title: Writing keyword "arguments" triggers: "Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'name' of undefined"
data.body:
This error appears whenever I'm coding JavaScript and writes the keyword "arguments" anywhere in the file. It was also present in the 0.151.0 version of Atom. My System is running Arch Linux with the latest updates.

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'name' of undefined

**Atom Version**: 0.153.0
**System**: linux 3.17.5-1-ck
**Thrown From**: [js-refactor](https://github.com/minodisk/js-refactor) package

data.title: Replace Button Too Small
data.body:
Sorry if this is a duplicate, I didn't really know how to search it.  My replace button is not large enough to show the entire word Replace.  I am not sure what version introduced this, as I haven't used find/replace much as of late.  I think it would have been after 0.150.0, but I'm not sure.

Screenshot:
![untitled-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1779681/5354808/9859b566-7f5a-11e4-8620-217a134c8d2d.png)

data.title: Auto indent still misbehaving
data.body:
Atom 0.154 on Mac OS.

![auto-ind](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/440132/5354669/deb66bfa-7f3f-11e4-8fd8-9d62e7b221d6.gif)

Code below (make sure your syntax mode is CoffeeScript). Follow the instructions therein.

```
$ ->
  $(window).load ->

# Copy the below and paste it on the line below $(window).load ->
# Make sure the cursor is indented one level in from $(window).load (col = 5)
    if 2 is 2
      celebrate()
```

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: undefined is not a function
data.body:
Uncaught TypeError: undefined is not a function

**Atom Version**: 0.154.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1
**Thrown From**: [minimap-git-diff](https://github.com/atom-minimap/minimap-git-diff) package
### Steps To Reproduce
1. Open project - which is a Git repository - from package Project Manager
2. Error appears
### Stack Trace

```
At /Users/nils/.atom/packages/minimap-git-diff/lib/minimap-git-diff-binding.coffee:17

TypeError: undefined is not a function
  at MinimapGitDiffBinding.module.exports.MinimapGitDiffBinding.activate (/Users/nils/.atom/packages/minimap-git-diff/lib/minimap-git-diff-binding.coffee:17:26)
  at /Users/nils/.atom/packages/minimap-git-diff/lib/minimap-git-diff.coffee:66:15
  at createdCallback (/Users/nils/.atom/packages/minimap/lib/mixins/view-management.coffee:53:40)
  at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/Users/nils/.atom/packages/minimap/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:71:11)
  at Minimap.module.exports.ViewManagement.onEditorAdded (/Users/nils/.atom/packages/minimap/lib/mixins/view-management.coffee:110:14)
  at /Users/nils/.atom/packages/minimap/lib/mixins/view-management.coffee:85:37

```

data.title: Uncaught Error: spawn pyflakes ENOENT
data.body:
Uncaught Error: spawn pyflakes ENOENT

**Atom Version**: 0.154.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.9.5
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

```
$ pyflakes --version
0.8.1
```

Linter 0.8.0, Linter Python Pyflakes 0.1.0 (bsnux)
### Steps To Reproduce
1. Started atom in a (mostly python) project with the following storage file:
   https://gist.github.com/jagill/833eac508959d3f1cf1b
2. Split pane vertically.
3. Saw error which told me to report it.
4. Possibly of note: The shell session which launched atom was also running under a python virtualenv.

```
$ which python
/Users/jag/euler/venv/bin/python
$ which pyflakes
/usr/local/bin/pyflakes
```
### Stack Trace

```
At events.js:85

Error: spawn pyflakes ENOENT
  at exports._errnoException (util.js:742:11)
  at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1051:32)
  at child_process.js:1142:20
  at process._tickCallback (node.js:378:11)

```

data.title: Test how multi-status builds look
data.body:
https://github.com/blog/1935-see-results-from-all-pull-request-status-checks

Using this PR to enable the status to display for the Linux and Windows builds.

data.title: Add `TextEditorElement` methods needed to replace deprecated APIs
data.body:
In order to avoid using deprecated APIs, the wrap-guide package needs to be able to:
- perform adjustments when a text editor element is attached to the DOM
- know a text editor element's default character width

data.title: can you guy speed up the launch of the app?
data.body: Compared to Sublime, the only disadvantage/drawback is slow startup
